description.narrative: • Typhoon Nock-Ten, known locally as Nina, made landfall on the eastern island province of Catanduanes on Christmas Day, moved westward on Monday, packing winds of up to 240 kilometers per hour and gusts of 290km/h, government forecasters said. • The typhoon made a total 8 land falls: Ground Zero is the island-province of Catanduanes which is said to be the hardest hit. The government has yet to know the extent of impact on this province as of this reporting. • Out of the 8 landfall areas, 5 are islands and therefore accessible mostly only by boat. Communication and information have been limited. Electric power is cut out in most of the affected areas. • A total of 602,770 persons were directly affected by the typhoon, according to the NDRRMC. • A total of 485,789 persons were preemptively moved to the evacuation centers. • Officials in the province of Albay, where more than 150,000 villagers were displaced by the typhoon, declared a "state of calamity" to allow faster disbursement of emergency funds.

• ADRA mobilized some of its staff currently residing in Camarines Sur (Region V) to conduct a rapid needs assessment particularly in the municipalities of Garchitorena, Presentacion and San Jose, where the EMBRACE project is also being implemented. • Distributed 850 shelter repair kits to affected households
